item.title: [CASSANDRA-9566] Running upgradesstables on 2.2 fails
item.description:
There is an assertion which fails when running upgradesstables when any new sstables have been flushed since the upgrade. This was tripped for me because the new system_auth keyspace had a new sstable, but writing to a table and flushing would cause the same result.

comments.comment:
problem is actually that we don't remove the skipped current-version sstable from the LifecycleTransaction.

Patch here: https://github.com/krummas/cassandra/commits/marcuse/9566

now I'll just try to figure out why our tests didn't catch this..
CASSANDRA-9569 for the tests

Perhaps we should update the filter method to void, and only accept the LifecycleTransaction, cancelling any it doesn't want? Might be clearer to future users.

Also a very minor suggestion: in markAllCompacting we can delete the isEmpty() test, as the Tracker.tryModify can cope just fine with an empty set of sstables now, so we can simply delete the null check at the top of haveparallelAllSSTableOperation, instead of merging them.

(Either way, +1)

Perhaps we should update the filter method to void

Yeah, I did that first, but we want cleanup to run on the smallest sstables first to free up space for the bigger ones later, so we need to be able to control the order of the sstables in the filter method.

in markAllCompacting we can delete the isEmpty() test,

done

updated the branch, will commit unless there are any cassci failures
